features.name: GitHub Environments UI Integration
features.description: Configure GitHub Actions workflows to use environments, making deployments visible in GitHub UI with direct links to preview and production sites
features.test_instructions:
1. Navigate to GitHub repository
2. Click 'Environments' in sidebar
3. Verify 'production' and 'preview' environments are listed
4. Click on environment to see deployment history
5. Click 'View deployment' button to open deployed site

features.name: Dynamic Time-Based Marker Resizing
features.description: Interactive timeline drawer with dynamic marker scaling based on event proximity to selected time. Shows events from 'Now' to 'Sunrise' with smooth animations

code_patterns.description: TimeDrawer class with marker scaling logic

features.test_instructions:
1. Open the app with 5+ events
2. Set filter to 'til sunrise'
3. Verify time drawer appears at bottom
4. Drag the handle left/right
5. Verify markers scale dynamically (70%-130%)
6. Verify largest markers have glow effect
7. Try with < 5 events - drawer should show threshold message
8. Change filter to '6h' - drawer should disappear
9. Test on mobile - touch gestures should work

features.name: Keyboard Navigation
features.description: Full keyboard controls for map navigation and event browsing - ESC to close popups, arrow keys to navigate events, +/- to zoom

code_patterns.description: Keyboard event handling and navigation logic

features.test_instructions:
1. Open the app and click on an event to view details
2. Press ESC - detail popup should close
3. Open an event detail again
4. Press Right Arrow - should navigate to next event (sorted by time)
5. Press Left Arrow - should navigate to previous event
6. Navigate past the last event - should wrap to first event
7. Press + or = key - map should zoom in
8. Press - or _ key - map should zoom out
9. Test that map centers on events during arrow navigation
10. Open filter dropdown and press ESC - dropdown should close

features.name: App Ready Signal for Screenshots
features.description: Emits a ready signal when the app is fully initialized (config loaded, map initialized, events loaded). Enables reliable screenshot generation by providing a data-app-ready attribute and custom event

code_patterns.description: App ready signal implementation and emission

features.test_instructions:
1. Start local server: cd static && python3 -m http.server 8000
2. Run test script: python3 scripts/generate_screenshots.py --verbose
3. Verify body[data-app-ready='true'] attribute is set after page load
4. Verify 'app-ready' custom event is dispatched with event.detail metadata
5. Check that screenshots are captured with fully loaded map and events
6. Verify both mobile (640×1136) and desktop (1280×800) screenshots are generated

features.name: HTML Export Linting
features.description: Comprehensive linting of exported HTML, including JavaScript, CSS, HTML structure, SVG content, translations, and accessibility (a11y) checks during site generation

code_patterns.description: Linter implementation with multiple validation methods
Integration of linter into site generation process

features.test_instructions:
1. Run unit tests: python3 tests/test_linter.py --verbose
2. Generate site: python3 src/event_manager.py generate
3. Verify linting output shows validation of:
   - JavaScript (checks for eval(), console.log, bracket matching)
   - CSS (checks for bracket matching, !important overuse)
   - HTML (checks for doctype, lang attribute, required tags)
   - SVG (checks for script tags, event handlers, security issues)
   - Translations (checks for completeness, consistency between languages)
   - Accessibility (checks for WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance)
4. Confirm build completes even with lint warnings (non-blocking)
5. Review lint report for actionable issues

features.name: Markdown to HTML Documentation Builder
features.description: Automated build system that converts all Markdown documentation to styled HTML with GitHub-style dark theme and Barbie Pink accents. Organizes files into docs/ directory, generates navigation index, converts links, and adds syntax highlighting. Works offline with pure HTML/CSS.

code_patterns.description: GitHub dark theme with Barbie Pink accents

features.test_instructions:
1. Install dependencies: pip install markdown>=3.5.0 Pygments>=2.17.0
2. Build documentation: python3 scripts/build_markdown_docs.py --organize --verbose
3. Verify all .md files converted to .html with:
   - GitHub dark theme (#0d1117 background, #c9d1d9 text)
   - Barbie Pink (#FF69B4) headings and accents
   - Syntax highlighting in code blocks
   - Navigation bar on every page
4. Verify file organization:
   - README.md/README.html stay in root
   - DOCUMENTATION_BUILD.md/DOCUMENTATION_BUILD.html stay in root
   - All other docs moved to docs/
5. Verify docs/index.html generated with categorized navigation
6. Test cleanup script: python3 scripts/cleanup_old_docs.py --dry-run
7. Open docs/index.html in browser and verify:
   - Works with file:// protocol (no server needed)
   - Navigation links work
   - All .md links converted to .html
   - Mobile responsive design
   - Syntax highlighting displays correctly

features.name: Pydantic Data Validation
features.description: Type-safe data validation using Pydantic models for events, locations, and configuration. Ensures data integrity throughout the pipeline with automatic validation and helpful error messages.

features.name: Robust Error Handling and Retry Logic
features.description: Graceful error handling with custom exceptions, exponential backoff retry logic for network requests, and source-level failure isolation. One failing source doesn't crash the entire scraping process.

code_patterns.description: Retry logic with exponential backoff using tenacity

features.test_instructions:
1. Run scraper with one invalid source: python3 src/event_manager.py scrape
2. Verify scraper continues despite source failure
3. Check logs for retry attempts and error details
4. Verify _write_scrape_status includes error summary

features.name: Structured Logging System
features.description: Centralized logging configuration with appropriate log levels (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL), structured context data, and separate configurations for CLI and TUI modes. Includes rotating file handlers for production debugging.
features.test_instructions:
1. Run CLI with debug: python3 src/event_manager.py scrape --debug
2. Verify DEBUG level logs appear
3. Run TUI: python3 src/event_manager.py
4. Verify logs written to logs/event_manager.log
5. Check log rotation works (max 5MB per file)

features.name: Configuration Validation
features.description: Validates config.json structure and values on load, including URLs, coordinates, and required fields. Provides helpful error messages with specific field names and expected values.
features.test_instructions:
1. Temporarily break config.json (invalid lat/lon, missing field)
2. Run: python3 src/event_manager.py list
3. Verify helpful ConfigurationError with field name
4. Restore config.json
